steps.description: Corporate traveller or TMC searches availability and negotiated corporate rates via Direct Connect API or corporate portal (dates, location, corporate rate code).
steps.businessRationale: Search latency and accuracy determine whether corporate inventory and negotiated rates are visible; slow or zero results cause immediate abandonment and lost corporate revenue.

steps.description: Traveller or travel manager selects a negotiated rate plan (corporate flexible, corporate non-refundable) and, if required, triggers internal approval workflow for higher-value bookings.
steps.businessRationale: Corporate bookings often require approval or policy checks; this step converts search intent into a committed booking and enables revenue capture and policy compliance.

steps.description: Booking request submitted via Direct Connect API or corporate portal; system reserves room, processes corporate billing instructions or card on file, and returns booking confirmation with booking reference.
steps.businessRationale: This is the revenue event: successful reservation creates recognized revenue potential; API reliability and payment processing determine confirmed bookings and downstream invoicing.

steps.description: Traveller receives confirmation, completes digital check-in (ID upload optional), selects room preferences and adds extras (breakfast, parking) via app or email link prior to arrival.
steps.businessRationale: Pre-check-in increases on-site efficiency and incremental revenue from add-ons; it also reduces front-desk load and improves NPS for corporate clients.

steps.description: Traveller completes digital or kiosk check-in, receives room access (mobile key or front-desk key), consumes stay services (breakfast, meeting room), and any incidental charges are recorded to folio.
steps.businessRationale: On-property experience affects retention and future corporate spend; accurate folio capture ensures correct invoicing and reduces disputes that delay revenue recognition.

steps.description: Corporate traveller or accounts payable retrieves invoice via corporate portal or email, validates charges against folio, downloads invoice PDF, and submits to corporate expense system or AP for payment.
steps.businessRationale: Timely, accurate invoicing reduces days sales outstanding (DSO) and prevents revenue leakage; poor invoice delivery increases disputes and administrative cost.
